oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Luke's Primitive Baptist Church, 2001 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of St Luke's Primitive Baptist Church located at 135 Lewis Street in Nashville, Tennessee. The foundation is made of rough cut stone blocks that have been painted white. The exterior walls are red brick. The roof is gabled and made of red tar shingles. The windows were originally gothic arched with an oculous over the front window, but are now bricked in. The current windows are rectangular with colored glass. The doors are metal and glass. Other features include ornate brick work over the front door. A fellowship hall sits directly next door to the church. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: St Luke's Primitive Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
